description: Unique ID within NEON database; an identifier for the record.
Unique identifier of the NEON domain
NEON site code
Plot identifier (NEON site code _XXX)
Date or date and time of measurement, observation, or collection event
Number of the night of trapping or collection event within the multi-night sampling bout.
An identifier for the set of information associated with the event, which includes information about the place and time of the event
Total number of traps set per reference area (site, plot, etc.)
Total number of set traps that were closed or disturbed.
The total amount of sampling effort (e.g. trapping effort) expended during a bout; with necessary corrections (e.g., for disturbed traps).
The NEON document number and version where detailed information regarding the sampling method used is available; format NEON.DOC.######vX.
A list of sources (concatenated and semicolon separated) used to derive the specific taxon concept; including field guide editions, books, or versions of NEON keys used.
Technician notes; free text comments accompanying the record.
Quality Flag for duplicate records per night
qfValues: Values: 0 duplicates not found per plotID and date combination| 1 duplicates per plotID and date combination rectified and removed, any non-identical values retained through concatenation into pipe delimited lists

description: Quality Flag for missing records at the bout level
qfValues: Values: 0 no missing records were found for the bout | 1 missing records were found for the bout

description: Unique ID within NEON database; an identifier for the record.
Unique identifier of the NEON domain
NEON site code
Plot identifier (NEON site code _XXX)
Relative coordinate of the trap within the given plotID (A1 - J10). If row or column coordinate is unknown, X is used.
Date or date and time of measurement, observation, or collection event
An identifier for the set of information associated with the event, which includes information about the place and time of the event

Categorical descriptor of trap status; 0 - no data; 1 - trap not set; 2 - trap disturbed/door closed but empty; 3 - trap door open or closed w/ spoor left; 4 - >1 capture in one trap; 5 - capture; 6 - trap set and empty
Quality Flag for duplicate records for trap coordinate
qfValues: Values: 0 duplicates not found for trap| 1 duplicates per trap rectified and removed | 2 duplicates per trap not rectified, and retained

description: Unique ID within NEON database; an identifier for the record.
Unique identifier of the NEON domain
NEON site code
Plot identifier (NEON site code _XXX)
Relative coordinate of the trap within the given plotID (A1 - J10). If row or column coordinate is unknown, X is used.
National Land Cover Database Vegetation Type Name
The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, WGS84) of the geographic center of the reference area.
The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, WGS84) of the geographic center of the reference area.
Model used to measure horizontal position on the earth
The horizontal distance (in meters) from the given decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude describing the smallest circle containing the whole of the Location. Zero is not a valid value for this term.
Elevation (in meters) above sea level
Uncertainty in elevation values (in meters)
Date or date and time of measurement, observation, or collection event
An identifier for the set of information associated with the event, which includes information about the place and time of the event
Domain-level unique identifier for an individual: NEON.MOD.D##.######
Species code, based on one or more sources
Scientific name, associated with the taxonID. This is the name of the lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined.
The lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined for the individual or specimen.
A standard term to express the determiner's doubts about the Identification
A categorical indicator of changes applied to an identification based on conflicting sources, where applicable.
M for male, F for female, U for unknown
The reproductive condition of the individual at the time of capture. R for reproductive; N for non-reproductive
Indicates whether or not the captured individual is a recapture; 'Y' for yes, 'N' for no
The fate of the individual, unless marked and released; 'dead' =  dead, 'escaped' = escaped while handling, 'nontarget' = released, non-target species
Indicates which ear tag was replaced (L#### | R####) or which ear appears to have lost a tag ('left' = left ear tag replaced; 'right' = right ear tag replaced)
The age class of the individual at the time the Occurrence was recorded. juvenile = obvious signs of a very young individual, small size, distinctive pelage coloration; subabult; adult
Condition of the testes at time of capture; if mature: scrotal = testes descended, nonscrotal = testes abdominal
Condition of the nipples at time of capture; if mature: enlarged = nipples enlarged, nonenlarged = nipples not enlarged
Condition at time of capture; if mature: 'pregnant' | 'not'
Condition of the vagina at time of capture; if mature: swollen, plugged, neither
length of left hindfoot; including claws; in millimeters
length of left ear; in millimeters
length of tail; in millimeters
total length (head + body); in millimeters
Live weight as measured with a spring scale; in grams
Unique identifier for the blood sample
Method used to collect the blood sample
Unique identifier for the fecal sample
Condition of fecal sample at time of collection; 'fresh' = fresh fecal sample collected from mammal; 'old' = 'Old' fecal sample collected from trap
Unique identifier for the ear sample
Unique identifier for the hair sample
Unique identifier for the whisker sample
Unique identifier for the voucher sample
An identifier for the technician who measured or collected the data.
An identifier for the technician who recorded the data.
Technician notes; free text comments accompanying the record.
Quality Flag for temporal consistency - Tag ID and Sex
qfValues: Values: -1 test not executed | 0 no inconsistency in sex and tagID across captures | 1 inconsistent sex and tagID across captures, sex appearing most often or when animal was reproductively active retained

description: Quality Flag for temporal consistency - Tag ID and Taxon ID
qfValues: Values: -1 test not executed | 0 no inconsistency in taxonID and tagID across captures | 1 inconsistent taxonID and tagID across captures, taxonID appearing most often retained

description: Quality Flag for temporal consistency - Tag ID and Life Stage
qfValues: Values: -1 test not executed | 0 no inconsistency in lifeStage and tagID across captures | 1 inconsistent lifeStage and tagID across captures

description: Quality Flag for order - Tag ID and Fate
Quality Flag for order - Life Stage
qfValues: Values: -1 test not executed | 0 order of lifeStage is correct across captures and through time | 1 order of lifeStage is incorrect across captures and through time
